messages.page_content:
- Topic: Establishment of a Conditional Use for a Childcare Center in an HU-RD2 Historic Urban Two-Family Residential District
- Summary: The ordinance aims to establish a conditional use to permit a childcare center in a specific residential district and provide related provisions. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33696 - 29031 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted, allowing for the conditional use of a childcare center in the specified residential district.
- Tags/Keywords: Conditional Use, Childcare Center, Residential District, Adoption
- UID: 7665e386-e7ad-4132-85df-d34d3a7d2e1c

- Topic: Oversight of American Rescue Plan Act (ARPA) Funding
- Summary: This ordinance requires the Chief Administrative Office and the Department of Finance to provide regular updates on ARPA funding allocated to the City of New Orleans and create a public-facing dashboard with programmatic initiatives and expenditure metrics. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33697 - 29032 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted, mandating regular updates and public transparency on ARPA funding and programmatic initiatives.
- Tags/Keywords: ARPA Funding, Oversight, Financial Transparency, Adoption
- UID: 7665e386-e7ad-4132-85df-d34d3a7d2e1c

- Topic: Monthly Updates on ARPA Funding and Public Dashboard Creation
- Summary: This ordinance requires regular updates on ARPA funding and the creation of a public dashboard with programmatic initiative metrics. The ordinance was adopted after being referred to the Budget Committee.
- Ordinance Number: 33698 - 29033 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted after being referred to the Budget Committee, ensuring regular updates and public transparency on ARPA funding and programmatic initiatives.
- Tags/Keywords: ARPA Funding, Public Dashboard, Financial Transparency, Adoption
- UID: 7665e386-e7ad-4132-85df-d34d3a7d2e1c

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Salary Increase for Commissioned Police Employees
- Summary: The ordinance requires the Department of City Civil Service to evaluate and provide recommendations for amending the Classified Pay Plan to implement an annual two percent increase in salary for commissioned police employees with three to twenty-three years of service with the New Orleans Police Department.
- Ordinance Number: 33713
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (Unanimous approval)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was recommended for approval by the Joint Criminal Justice - Community Development Committee and was ultimately adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: Salary Increase, Police Employees, Civil Service, Commission, Classified Pay Plan
- UID: 0d60970b-d99d-466a-86fa-6dffe01f004e

- Topic: Appropriation of State Capital Outlay Funds for Lower Ninth Ward Main Street Initiative
- Summary: The ordinance seeks to amend the city's operating budget to appropriate state Capital Outlay funds to support the Lower Ninth Ward Main Street initiative led by Sankofa Community Development Corporation.
- Ordinance Number: 33715
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (Unanimous approval)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was recommended for approval by the Budget Committee and was ultimately adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: State Capital Outlay Funds, Operating Budget, Lower Ninth Ward, Sankofa Community Development Corporation
- UID: 0d60970b-d99d-466a-86fa-6dffe01f004e

- Tags/Keywords: State Capital Outlay Funds, Operating Budget, Lower Ninth Ward, Sankofa Community Development Corporation
- UID: 0d60970b-d99d-466a-86fa-6dffe01f004e

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Exterior Building Design Amendments
- Summary: The ordinance proposed amendments to the exterior building design, including changing lighting and adding curved railing. Proponents and opponents spoke on the issue, and it was ultimately adopted.

- Topic: Resolution on State Legal Actions
- Summary: The resolution demanded the State of Louisiana to cease legal actions against Road Home Elevation recipients, with support from Congressman Troy Carter. It passed unanimously.
- Ordinance Number: R-22-231
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopt - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)

messages.page_content:
- Topic: R-22-231 - Tabulating the votes cast in the Election held on Saturday, April 30, 2022 - EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION MILLAGE
- Summary: The ordinance focused on tabulating the votes for the Early Childhood Education Millage election. The total votes were 24,796, with 15,092 in favor and 9,704 against. The majority of votes were in favor of the millage.
- Ordinance Number: R-22-231
- Votes Summary:
  - Vote 1: Adopt - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion was adopted with all council members voting in favor.
- Tags/Keywords: Election, Early Childhood Education, Millage
- UID: 60e6a093-6b77-4d57-a44b-3058ca931181

- Topic: M-22-230 - HDLC APPEAL OF MARY HALPERN
- Summary: This ordinance addressed the HDLC appeal of Mary Halpern. The motion was adopted with all council members voting in favor.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-230
- Votes Summary:
  - Vote 1: Adopt - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion to appeal the HDLC appeal of Mary Halpern was adopted unanimously.
- Tags/Keywords: HDLC, Appeal, Mary Halpern
- UID: 60e6a093-6b77-4d57-a44b-3058ca931181

The motion was granted in part and denied in part, contingent on outstanding violations and related fines being cleared.

- Topic: Appropriation of Grant Funds for Project Rebirth Program
- Summary: The ordinance seeks to appropriate grant funds from The Delta Regional Authority Delta Workforce Grant to the City of New Orleans Office of Workforce Development for the Project Rebirth program to build a Re-Entry Talent Pipeline over a two-year period.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,729
- Votes Summary:

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Operating Budget and AmeriCorps VISTA Program
- Summary: The ordinance aims to provide an operating budget for the City of New Orleans for the year 2022 and appropriate federal funds awarded to the Mayor's Office AmeriCorps VISTA Program. 
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,731
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)

- Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement with University of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor of the City of New Orleans to enter into Amendment No. 2 to a previously executed Cooperative Endeavor Agreement between the City and the University of New Orleans to modify and extend the agreement for the restoration of the City's infrastructure damaged by Hurricane Katrina. 
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,732
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was passed without any opposing votes.
- Tags/Keywords: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement, University of New Orleans, Infrastructure Restoration
- UID: 8120d1b3-1fa9-4a0e-8d5f-4cd053c5902b

- Topic: Conditional Use Permit for a Neighborhood Commercial Establishment
- Summary: The ordinance seeks to establish a conditional use to permit a neighborhood commercial establishment in a specific residential district in New Orleans. 
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,733
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 1 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with one opposing vote.
- Tags/Keywords: Conditional Use, Neighborhood Commercial Establishment, Zoning
- UID: 8120d1b3-1fa9-4a0e-8d5f-4cd053c5902b

- Topic: Conditional Use Ordinance for Hotel in CBD-5 Urban Core Neighborhood Lower Intensity Mixed-Use District
- Summary: An ordinance was proposed to establish a conditional use to permit a hotel in a specific district. The ordinance was electronically submitted and had a deadline of 90 days. The ordinance number is 19/22.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)

messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 5-19-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Parklet Permitting Program
- Summary: The ordinance aims to create a Parklet permitting program, allowing public parking spaces within parking lanes on City controlled streets to be utilized by adjacent commercial entities for additional seating and public use. 
- Ordinance Number: 33737
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with unanimous support from the council members.
- Tags/Keywords: Parklet, Permitting Program, Public Parking, Commercial Entities
- UID: d3e18897-ea08-4764-821d-ea996b71472a

- Topic: New Orleans Abuse Fatality Review Team
- Summary: This ordinance aims to create the New Orleans Abuse Fatality Review Team, establishing regulations and requirements for comprehensive review of all fatalities that occur in the City of New Orleans as a result of domestic abuse. 
- Ordinance Number: 33738
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with unanimous support from the council members.
- Tags/Keywords: Abuse Fatality Review, Domestic Abuse, Regulations, Review Team
- UID: d3e18897-ea08-4764-821d-ea996b71472a

- Topic: Sale of Portion of Ground on Willow St.
- Summary: This ordinance involves revoking the dedication to public use and authorizing the sale at public auction of a certain portion of ground on Willow St. that is no longer needed for public purposes.
- Ordinance Number: 33739
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with unanimous support from the council members.
- Tags/Keywords: Public Use Revocation, Sale at Auction, Willow St., Public Purposes
- UID: d3e18897-ea08-4764-821d-ea996b71472a

messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 5-19-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Ordinance requiring LEED Gold certification for public office buildings
- Summary: The ordinance requires all public office buildings constructed or rehabilitated by the City of New Orleans to meet the United States Green Buildings Council’s LEED Gold certification. It was electronically submitted and the postponement deadline was 9/16/22.
- Ordinance Number: 33743
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopt - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted with 6 YEAS and 0 NAYS.
- UID: 95738bb8-61c7-486e-96e8-79933597be55

- Topic: Amendment and regulation of electric scooters
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend and regulate sections of the Code of the City of New Orleans to distinguish bicycles and electric scooters, and to provide for prohibitions and regulations relative to electric scooters.
- Ordinance Number: 33744
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: No specific voting outcome was provided for this ordinance.
- UID: 95738bb8-61c7-486e-96e8-79933597be55
